content.title: Renal Fibromuscular Dysplasia
content.definition: Non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory arterial disease affecting the renal arteries, causing renovascular hypertension through intrinsic arterial wall abnormalities.

clinical_features.multifocal: May affect other vascular beds (carotid, vertebral)

concepts.definition: Classification based on arterial layer involved.

clinical_features.imaging_correlation: Medial type has classic angiographic appearance

clinical_features.hypertension: Severe or refractory hypertension in young patient
clinical_features.incidental: May be found incidentally on imaging

clinical_features.cta: String of beads in mid to distal main renal artery
clinical_features.mra: Similar findings but may miss subtle disease
clinical_features.duplex: Elevated velocities, turbulence in mid vessel
clinical_features.dsa: Gold standard, shows classic string of beads

clinical_features.medical: Antihypertensive therapy for blood pressure control
clinical_features.angioplasty: Balloon angioplasty highly effective for medial FMD
clinical_features.surgery: Reserved for failed PTA, branch disease, aneurysm

clinical_features.outcomes: Cure or improvement of hypertension in 70-90% after PTA
clinical_features.screening: Screen for FMD in other territories if found in one location

sources.reference: Kadian-Dodov D et al. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2019;73:2897-2914
